subdisciplines.name: Social Influence
subdisciplines.description: The study of how people's thoughts, feelings, and behaviors are influenced by the actual, imagined, or implied presence of others.

subdisciplines.name: Social Cognition
subdisciplines.description: The study of how people perceive, think about, and remember information about themselves and others.

subdisciplines.name: Social Identity
subdisciplines.description: The study of how people develop and maintain a sense of self in relation to their social group memberships.

subdisciplines.name: Interpersonal Attraction
subdisciplines.description: The study of what makes people attractive to others and why people form relationships with certain individuals.

subdisciplines.name: Intergroup Relations
subdisciplines.description: The study of how people in different social groups perceive, think about, feel toward, and behave toward members of other groups.
